hevs.gdx2d.lib

Class PortableApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • hevs.gdx2d.lib.PortableApplication
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameInterface, GestureInterface, KeyboardInterface, TouchInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Benchmarker, GdxGraphicsTest

    public abstract class PortableApplication
extends java.lang.Object
implements TouchInterface, KeyboardInterface, GameInterface, GestureInterface
    The base class that should be sub-classed by all gdx2d applications. To get the functionalities you simply have tod overload the methods you need.
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Pierre-Andr√© Mudry (mui), Christopher Metrailler (mei)
    See Also:
    TouchInterface, KeyboardInterface, GameInterface

      • PortableApplication

        @Deprecated
public PortableApplication(boolean onAndroid)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates an application using gdx2d. Use a default windows size.
        Parameters:
        onAndroid - true if running on Android, false otherwise

      • PortableApplication

        public PortableApplication()
        Creates an application using gdx2d. Use a default windows size.

      • PortableApplication

        @Deprecated
public PortableApplication(boolean onAndroid,
                                       int width,
                                       int height)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates an application using gdx2d. Screen dimension are ignored when running on Android.
        Parameters:
        onAndroid - true if running on Android, false otherwise
        width - The width of the screen (only for desktop)
        height - The height of the screen (only for desktop)

      • PortableApplication

        public PortableApplication(int width,
                           int height)
        Creates an application using gdx2d. Screen dimension are ignored when running on Android.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the screen (only for desktop)
        height - The height of the screen (only for desktop)

      • PortableApplication

        public PortableApplication(int width,
                           int height,
                           boolean fullScreen)
        Create a full-screen gdx2d application.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the screen
        height - The height of the screen
        fullScreen - Indicates if the application should be launched full screen on desktop, or in default resolution

      • PortableApplication

        @Deprecated
public PortableApplication(boolean onAndroid,
                                       int width,
                                       int height,
                                       boolean fullScreen)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates an application using gdx2d, running full screen or not on desktop. Screen dimension are ignored when running on Android.
        Parameters:
        onAndroid - true if running on Android, false otherwise
        width - The width of the screen (only for desktop)
        height - The height of the screen (only for desktop)
        fullScreen - true to create a fullscreen application (only for desktop)

    • Method Detail

      • onAndroid

        public boolean onAndroid()
        Detect android
        Returns:
        true when running on Android.

      • setTitle

        public void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Change the title of the application window (works only on desktop). This method has no effect (ignored) when running on Android.
        Parameters:
        title - the application title

      • getWindowHeight

        public int getWindowHeight()
        Rendering surface information

        Rendering surface information
        Returns:
        The width of the display surface (window)

      • exit

        public void exit()
        Schedule an exit from the application. On android, this will cause a call to onPause() and onDispose() some time in the future, it will not immediately finish your application.

      • onClick

        public void onClick(int x,
                    int y,
                    int button)
        Description copied from interface: TouchInterface
        Invoked when the pointer (mouse or touch) is pressed (once). The button parameter will be Input.Buttons#LEFT on Android.
        Specified by:
        onClick in interface TouchInterface
        Parameters:
        x - the screen X coordinate (origin is the lower left corner)
        y - the screen Y coordinate (origin is the lower left corner)
        button - Input.Buttons#LEFT or Input.Buttons#RIGHT button clicked
        See Also:
        TouchInterface.onClick(int, int, int)

        Parameters:

      • onResume

        public void onResume()
        Description copied from interface: GameInterface
        Called when the application is restarted. Called only when running on Android.
        Initializations and creation of new new objects must be done here.
        Specified by:
        onResume in interface GameInterface
        See Also:
        GameInterface.onResume()

      • onZoom

        public void onZoom(float initialDistance,
                   float distance)
        Description copied from interface: GestureInterface
        Called when the user performs a pinch zoom gesture on Android. The original distance is the distance in pixels when the gesture started.
        Specified by:
        onZoom in interface GestureInterface
        Parameters:
        initialDistance - distance between fingers when the gesture started
        distance - current distance between fingers
        See Also:
        GestureInterface.onZoom(float, float)

      • onTap

        public void onTap(float x,
                  float y,
                  int count,
                  int button)
        Description copied from interface: GestureInterface
        Invoked for a tap gesture on Android. A tap happens if a touch went down on the screen and was lifted again without moving outside of the tap square.
        Specified by:
        onTap in interface GestureInterface
        Parameters:
        x - the screen X coordinate (origin is the lower left corner)
        y - the screen Y coordinate (origin is the lower left corner)
        count - the number of taps
        button - Input.Buttons#LEFT or Input.Buttons#RIGHT button clicked
        See Also:
        GestureInterface.onTap(float, float, int, int)

      • onPinch

        public void onPinch(Vector2 initialPointer1,
                    Vector2 initialPointer2,
                    Vector2 pointer1,
                    Vector2 pointer2)
        Description copied from interface: GestureInterface
        Called when a user performs a pinch zoom gesture on Android. Reports the initial positions of the two involved fingers and their current positions.
        Specified by:
        onPinch in interface GestureInterface
        Parameters:
        initialPointer1 - finger 1 initial position
        initialPointer2 - finger 2 initial position
        pointer1 - finger 1 current position
        pointer2 - finger 2 current position
        See Also:
        GestureInterface.onPinch(Vector2, Vector2, Vector2, Vector2)

      • onPan

        public void onPan(float x,
                  float y,
                  float deltaX,
                  float deltaY)
        Description copied from interface: GestureInterface
        Called when the user drags a finger over the screen on Android.
        Specified by:
        onPan in interface GestureInterface
        Parameters:
        x - the screen X coordinate (origin is the lower left corner)
        y - the screen Y coordinate (origin is the lower left corner)
        deltaX - the difference in pixels to the last drag event on x
        deltaY - the difference in pixels to the last drag event on y
        See Also:
        GestureInterface.onPan(float, float, float, float)

      • onLongPress

        public void onLongPress(float x,
                        float y)
        Description copied from interface: GestureInterface
        Called on long press on Android.
        Specified by:
        onLongPress in interface GestureInterface
        Parameters:
        x - the screen X coordinate (origin is the lower left corner)
        y - the screen Y coordinate (origin is the lower left corner)
        See Also:
        GestureInterface.onLongPress(float, float)

      • onFling

        public void onFling(float velocityX,
                    float velocityY,
                    int button)
        Description copied from interface: GestureInterface
        Called when the user dragged a finger over the screen and lifted it. Reports the last known velocity of the finger in pixels per second.
        Specified by:
        onFling in interface GestureInterface
        Parameters:
        velocityX - velocity on x in seconds
        velocityY - velocity on y in seconds
        button - Input.Buttons#LEFT or Input.Buttons#RIGHT button clicked
        See Also:
        GestureInterface.onFling(float, float, int)

      • getAndroidResolver

        public AndroidResolver getAndroidResolver()
        Return the AndroidResolver to use Android actions.
        Returns:
        The resolver, or null if no running on Android
        Since:
        1.1

      • setAndroidResolver

        public void setAndroidResolver(AndroidResolver resolver)
        Set the AndroidResolver when the application is created on Android. The resolver must be create in an Android Activity with its Context
        Parameters:
        resolver - the Android resolver
        Since:
        1.1
